sentences.sContent: The U.S. is contributing $4 billion in loans, credits, and grants.
sentences.sCn: 美国以信贷和赠与的方式捐助了40亿美元。

sentences.sContent: Local businesses have agreed to contribute.
sentences.sCn: 当地的公司已经同意捐助了。

sentences.sContent: ...you have to contribute knowledge to the joint venture...
...Partly what we do as human beings is to take care of others and contribute to others...
...A new study claims happiness may not contribute to health...
...sports programs contribute to students' academic performance and character building...
...What factors might contribute to diploma discrimination...
...How often did you feel that you had something to contribute to society...
...Social learning theories contribute to our understanding of why we behave as we do...
...tackling food waste will help contribute towards addressing a number of key resource issues...
...Obstacles deliberately placed in the creation of music contribute to its success...
...they continue to generate maintenance expenses that contribute to the high cost of running a college...
...we individuals should contribute our own efforts to the study and protection of Chinese language...
...Sometimes you have a strong feeling that something is important and you want to see it examined and you want to contribute to a public debate...
...Stress may also contribute to disease in less direct ways by influencing moods and behavior...

synos.tran: 贡献，出力；[图情]投稿；[经]捐献
贡献，出力；[图情]投稿；[经]捐献

remMethod.val: con ＋ tribute(给予) → 共同给予 → 捐献

words.tran: 捐助的；贡献的；有助于…的
出资的；贡献的；有助于；助长...的

trans.tranOther: To contribute money or resources to something means to give money or resources to help pay for something or to help achieve a particular purpose
